comments.body: While not required, wouldn't it be better to add aliases to `upgrade` for `update_ports` and `update_cache` so this module is backwards compatible? You could add a warning if you like with `module.deprecate()` if you plan to remove those parameter names in the future.

Thanks for looking at this, @samdoran . I did add them as aliases, to the `selfupdate` parameter:

https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/45049/files#diff-9dd84c85f00a1d2014c3d2814f2bca38R36

The `upgrade` parameter is new functionality, and actually upgrades the installed packages, whereas `selfupdate` is replacing `update_ports`.
Ok, I see it now. Thanks!

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +271,275 @@            selfupdate=dict(aliases=["update_cache", "update_ports"], default=False, type='bool'),
            state=dict(default="present", choices=["present", "installed", "absent", "removed", "active", "inactive"]),
            upgrade=dict(default=False, type='bool'),
            variant=dict(aliases=["variants"], default=None, type='str')
        )
